FacilityName: City of Winfield Municipal Swimming Pool

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Amusement and Recreation Industries

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of the City of Winfield Municipal Swimming Pool are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of chlorine.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Cowley County LEPC, and/or other authoriteies, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is to provide a recreation area for the residents of the area.  Chlorine is stored in tanks designed for that purpose and maintained in accordance with our maintenance procedures.

3.  Accidental Release Prevention  Program.  The City of Winfield abidies by all pertinent EPA Risk Management Program regulations to guard against accidental releases of chlorine at the swimming pool, and if does occur, to minimize the harm to the surrounding community and the environment.

4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of chlorine during the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program. The facility has a written emergency action plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of chlorine takes place at our facility, the response is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facilty.  Perodic evaluations are performed to access the condition of the facility.  There are no specific safety recommendations regarding the storage or the use of chlorine for implementation at this time.
